conbody.p: A subform is a form that is included in another form, called the main form. subforms are often used when you need to display data from tables and queries with a one-to-many relationship. The data from the one-side are in the main form and the data from the many-side in the subform. With a main-subform you can show the data of a customer and the corresponding orders. The data in the table Customers compose the one-side and are present in the main form. The data in the table Orders compose the many-side and are present in the subform.
The main form and subform are linked, so that the subform only shows records that are related to the current record in the main form.
